meanings.definition: To remove the feathers or plumage from (a bird)
meanings.sent1: The farmer had to deplume the chicken before cooking it.
meanings.sent2: The ornithologist carefully deplumed the bird for research purposes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to deplume the stuffed owl in the living room.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to deplume the trees of their autumn leaves overnight.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick involved magically depluming a dove during the performance.

meanings.definition: To strip of honors or rank
meanings.sent1: The scandal caused the politician to deplume his own reputation.
meanings.sent2: The king decided to deplume the traitor of his knighthood.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's goal was to deplume the class clown of his popularity.
meanings.sent4: The defeat in the championship game seemed to deplume the team of their confidence.
meanings.sent5: The harsh criticism from the judge deplumed the contestant's self-esteem.
